text:
Hello, I would like to know if we can create an email with a full-width image on the mobile version. For example, attached is the screenshot from the test email which has a border on the side of the image. The image is a custom module we created through CSS coding and here is the code below-
{% linked_image image-align= '{{ center }}', label="Linked Image", src='{{ module.img.src }}', alt='{{ module.img.alt }}', width='100%', height='auto', link='{{ link }}', target='{{ target }}', open_in_new_tab='{{ target }}', size_type='{{ module.img.size_type }}', loading='{{ loadingAttr }}' %}
We kept the "width=100%" but it didn't make any difference. We still have a space on both the sides. Is there a way to have full-width image on mobile version for the marketing emails? Looking forward to the response. Thanks, Uttu

Hello,

I have a question regarding the preview of the emails in dark mode on gmail app-

For gmail app on IOS, our email appears weirdly in the dark mode. If the background of our email is dark, it appears light in the gmail app of IOS dark mode. Here's also examples attached of how it appears in Dark mode of IOS.

Is there a way to fix this?

Could this be a solution? -->
"Creating a custom template that would allow us to insert a CSS tag in the background (not possible without a custom template) that would detect if the client has activated darkmode, and thus adapt the background color accordingly. "

Thank you again,
This screenshot looks like the Gmail mobile app. The white on either side is a part of the Gmail mobile app’s UI, so no you can’t remove it.
What Courtney said, unless you’re referring to the dark gray?

The text you quoted is not a solution because Gmail does not support it.

The note about using a custom template, however, _is_ good advice. There are other solutions available to you but yes, they all require that you use a custom template.
